intro: Clidemia acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite, ovate leaves with acute tips. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Clidemia acutifolia often grows on the branches of trees, forming dense foliage that can shade out surrounding vegetation.
